summary: This document details the execution of a search warrant on Little St. James, where various electronic devices and documents were collected as evidence in relation to Jeffrey Epstein's case involving child sex trafficking. The items collected include computers, notepads, photographs, and other digital devices.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the primary subject of the investigation related to child sex trafficking, and the search warrant was executed at his property.

persons.name: Chris Kroblin
persons.context: Chris Kroblin is mentioned as the attorney from whom evidence was collected during the search warrant execution.

connections.description: Chris Kroblin is the attorney representing Jeffrey Epstein in legal matters.

events.title: Evidence Collection
events.description: Evidence was collected from Little St. James pursuant to a search warrant, including various electronic devices and documents.

events.title: Search Warrant Execution
events.description: A search warrant was executed on Little St. James as part of the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's activities.

keyFacts: The search warrant was executed on August 22, 2019.
Evidence was collected on August 12, 2019, including multiple computers and digital devices.
Chris Kroblin is identified as Jeffrey Epstein's attorney in the context of the search.
Items collected included notepads, photographs, and various electronic devices.
The search was part of an investigation into child sex trafficking involving Jeffrey Epstein.
